p.s: The blogpost Globalised Environmental Pollution - Causes and Effects written by Ankita Mitra and published on the 5th of February 2014 on her blog, is about environmental pollution, why it exists and how it affects humans and nature.
The author starts off by introducing pollution and the natural balance that has enabled life on earth.
Mitra then moves on to explaining the origins of environmental pollution - urbanization and industrialization.
Following that, Mitra states that pollution has devastating effects on the flora, fauna and human health.
By mentioning the question whether today's industrial growth and scientific progress is good, she explains that traffic, industries and nuclear power are also causes of pollution.
As a result, our food, water and air are contaminated.
Other effects that the author mentions include extinction, diseases and the leakage of poisonous gas at Bhopal, 1984 which resulted in over 2000 deaths.
The author ends her blogpost by saying that the ecological balance urgently needs to be restored.
